bibl.title: Letter from José Rodriguez Pérez to Philip Showalter Hench, September 9, 1941

div1.p: Pérez writes that he has commissioned someone to help him get photostats of the history of Military Hospital No. 1.

div1.head: Letter from José Rodriguez Pérez to Philip Showalter Hench, September 9, 1941
div1.p:
Instituto Finlay
-----
La Habana
--
September 9, 1941. Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:

I received your letter of August
20th. in which you ask information about the cost
of the photostats of the history of Military Hos-
pital Numer One, of Galliol, 1903. To this effect,
I have commissioned Miss Malaret, whom you already
know, and she will write you personally in order
to send you the desired information.

Were it not out of the scope of my
activities, it would have been a pleasure to send
you directly said information.

Very truly yours,
Dr. José Rodriguez Pérez
LIBRARIAN

REPUBLICA DE CUBA
----
MINISTERIO DE SALUBRIDAD Y ASISTENCIA SOCIAL
-------
INSTITUTO FINLAY.
(DEPENDENCIA)
September 15, 1941. AL CONTESTAR CONSIGNESE FECHA Y NUMERO
DE ESTA COMUNICACION.
EN CADA ESCRITO TRATESE DE UN SOLO
ASUNTO.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:

I have been commissioned by Dr. José
Rodriguez Pérez, librarian of the Finlay Institute
to give you information regarding the photostats
of the “Memorias del Hospital Número Uno” men-
tioned in your letter to him.

I have been informed by “The Alabama Photo
Studios”, specialized in this kind of work, that
the cost of the forty seven pages, (not including
the photographs and maps it contains) would be
$21.50. They did not give me price of the adjoin-
ing maps and photographs as I was not allowed to
take the book out of the library, but I calculate
that the approximate cost of the whole book would
be about $25.00.

In case that you agree on this price and
wish to come in contact with the “Alabama Photo
Studios”, directly, the address is Obispo Num.314,
Havana. If on the contrary you wish me to take
this in hand for you, please send me the import
in money order. I will gladly attend to it.

Very truly yours,
Blanca Malaret
Secretary to Dr. Saladrigas

Instituto Finlay
----
Comitŕ Gubernativo
----
La Habana
----
September 15, 1941. Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:

I am in receipt of your kind letter
of August 16th and wish to thank you for it.

As regards as to the photostasts of
the whole book “Memorias del Hospital Número Uno”,
Dr. José Rodriguez Pérez, Librarian of the Finlay
Institute, has informed me that he has commission-
ed Miss Malaret to send you price of same. She
is writing you today by this same mail.

I appreciate very much your kindness
in offering me a copy of the photograph that you
sent me, but I have one already which was given
me some time ago by Dr. Hugo Roberts. However, I
wish to thank you once again for your attention.

With best personal wishes and regards,
I am

Sincerely yours,
Dr. Antonio Diaz Albertini.
